pullRequest.body:
Moves:
- Matrix.dotProduct -> dotProduct
- Matrix.dotProductᵣ -> dotProductᵣ
- The notation `⬝ᵥ` will no longer be scoped.
- Lemmas about `dotProduct` that don't talk about matrices will be unnamespaced accordingly

### PR summary [7a51749001](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19910/commits/7a517490013a775409702204f23d9d484eaae2e5)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Matrix.add_dotProduct`
`+ Matrix.comp_equiv_dotProduct_comp_equiv`
`+ Matrix.comp_equiv_symm_dotProduct`
`+ Matrix.diagonal_dotProduct`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_add`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_assoc`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_comm`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_comp_equiv_symm`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_diagonal`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_diagonal'`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_eq`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_eq_iff`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_eq_zero`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_eq_zero_iff`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_le_dotProduct_of_nonneg_left`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_le_dotProduct_of_nonneg_right`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_neg`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_nonneg_of_nonneg`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_one`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_pUnit`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_self_eq_zero`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_self_star_eq_zero`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_self_star_nonneg`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_single`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_single_one`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_smul`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_star_self_eq_zero`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_star_self_nonneg`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_sub`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_zero`
`+ Matrix.dotProduct_zero'`
`+ Matrix.neg_dotProduct`
`+ Matrix.neg_dotProduct_neg`
`+ Matrix.one_dotProduct`
`+ Matrix.one_dotProduct_one`
`+ Matrix.single_dotProduct`
`+ Matrix.single_one_dotProduct`
`+ Matrix.smul_dotProduct`
`+ Matrix.sub_dotProduct`
`+ Matrix.sum_elim_dotProduct_sum_elim`
`+ Matrix.zero_dotProduct`
`+ Matrix.zero_dotProduct'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Unfortunately
```
@[deprecated (since := "2024-12-12")] alias Matrix.dotProduct := dotProduct
```
messes up with all files that open the `Matrix` namespace.

Can I simply remove it and leave no deprecation warning?

> You're missing the deprecations, but I agree with this change.

And do you agree with the reason why the deprecations are missing?
@madvorak, does deprecating the lemmas work, even if it doesn't for the main definition?
Hadn't seen your comment above. Something else you could do is make the deprecated lemmas protected (though that of course makes the deprecations much less useful).

> @madvorak, does deprecating the lemmas work, even if it doesn't for the main definition?

The same problem. Lean thinks that the deprecated version is used.
Is `protected alias` useful? Should I do it for the rest as well?
You're missing the deprecations, but I agree with this change.
You're missing the deprecations, but I agree with this change.

pullRequest.title: chore: unnamespace `Matrix.dotProduct`
